Description: Prosecution of Nizamuddin Gorji after an employee fell approximately 30 feet through a glass skylight on a warehouse roof in Blackburn. Mr Gorji was contracted by Floors ‘n’ Carpets Limited to over-clad the existing roof. Three operatives were employed by Mr Gorji to carry out the work.   On the 14th May 2020 one of the employees fell through the roof sustaining severe life changing injuries. The investigation by HSE found that Mr Gorji had failed to adequately plan the roof work or consider the equipment required. Specifically, the use of scaffolding around the building and under-slinging nets, covering fragile skylights and asbestos cement sheets. He had not completed any health and safety training and did not adequately train the operatives he employed.
